intro: Tarenna gossweileri var. brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
